Package gui.UserScreens

Class CustomerMainScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.ScreenController
gui.UserScreens.CustomerMainScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomerMainScreenController extends ScreenController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is responsible for the main menu of the Customer. It contains methods for initializing the view, handling events related to logging out, creating new orders, grabbing existing orders, and viewing deliveries.
Author:
Lior Jigalo

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the main menu view by setting the visibility of certain buttons, setting text fields to display information about the current user, and sending a message to the server to request customer data.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the FXML file associated with this controller.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object.

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "Exit" button. Closes the program.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the mouse clicking the "Exit" button.

    • logOut

      void logOut(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "Log Out" button. Sends a message to the server to request log out, sets the current user and customer to null, and switches to the log in screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "Log Out" button.

    • NewOrder

      void NewOrder(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "New Order" button. Sets the supply method of the current order to "instant pickup" and switches to the appropriate screen depending on whether the user is EK or OL.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "New Order" button.

    • GrabOrder

      void GrabOrder(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "Grab Order" button. Switches to the "Grab Order" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "Grab Order" button.

    • ViewDeliveries

      void ViewDeliveries(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "View Deliveries" button. Switches to the "View Deliveries" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "View Deliveries" button.
